page.title: 06Ecology of Mark
page.content: Some of the most common{trees}in Mark are Ash,Oak,Beech,Apple and once upon a time Elm. Owing to the dreadful Dutch Elm Disease, most of the Elms have disappeared. New young Elms,resistant to the disease are now being planted but it will be 30 to 40 years before they will be seen again in any great numbers. The most common{wild animals}are rabbits<having recovered from the equally dreaded Miximatosis>,foxes and mink. All these animals can be considered pests but people in general dislike setting traps or hunting them. Even here deep in the country {pollution}rears its ugly head. Locals blame crop spraying and septic tanks for this although it is not really too serious a problem here. We are on the edge of the Somerset Levels here. Many birds breed there.
